questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph on Vision of a New Bangladesh in about 200 words.

sub_questions.explanation:
Vision of a New Bangladesh
Bangladesh is a beautiful country with a bright future. A new Bangladesh means a better and stronger country where people live happily. In the future, we want a country with good education for all. Every child should go to school and get the best learning. Universities should provide world-class education so that students can work anywhere in the world. A new Bangladesh will have more jobs. No one will be poor, and everyone will earn enough to live a good life. Farmers will use modern machines, and industries will grow. Roads will be smooth, and traffic jams will be less. Villages will have electricity, clean water, and hospitals. Our environment will be clean, and rivers will not be polluted. There will be more trees and green parks. Climate change will not harm our people because we will take care of nature. In a new Bangladesh, all the people will live in peace and dignity. There will be no crime or corruption. The government will work for the welfare of the people. If we all
work hard and stay honest, we can build this new Bangladesh.

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph showing causes and effects of Drug Addiction in Bangladesh within 200 words.

sub_questions.explanation:
the causes and effects of drug addiction in Bangladesh :
Drug addiction has become a serious social problem in Bangladesh, particularly among the youth. There are several causes behind this growing issue. One major cause is frustration due to unemployment, family problems, and social pressure. Many young people fall into addiction as an escape from stress, failure, or emotional pain. Peer pressure and curiosity also play a big role in leading teenagers toward drugs. In urban areas, easy availability of drugs such as yaba, heroin, and phensedyl worsens the situation. Lack of awareness and proper guidance from families and educational institutions also contributes to the spread of addiction.
The effects of drug addiction are extremely harmful to both individuals and society. Physically, it damages the health of the user, often leading to deadly diseases and even death. Mentally, it causes depression, anxiety, and loss of self-control. Socially, drug addicts may turn to crime, such as theft or violence, to support their habit. Families of addicts suffer from emotional and financial distress. Moreover, addiction lowers the productivity of the youth, weakening the overall development of the country.
To fight this problem, proper education, strong family support, and strict law enforcement are essential. Public awareness must also be raised to save the youth from this dangerous path.
